intro: Maoutia aspera, commonly known as the rough maoutia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
